sentences.en: During the filming, Curtis fell in love with his co-star, Christine Kaufmann.
sentences.cn: 在电影摄制过程中，柯蒂斯爱上了同他联袂主演的明星克里斯汀·考夫曼。

sentences.en: Evans had rheumatic fever, missed school and fell behind.
sentences.cn: 伊万斯得了风湿热，没去上课，功课也落下了。

sentences.en: He fell asleep just past midnight with tolerable ease.
sentences.cn: 他刚过午夜就睡着了，睡得还算安稳。

sentences.en: He then keeled over and fell flat on his back.
I fell under the influence of a history master.
sentences.cn: 我当时深受一位历史老师的影响。

sentences.en: In early trading in Tokyo, the dollar fell sharply against the yen.
sentences.cn: 在东京市场早市开盘时，美元对日元的比价急剧下跌。

sentences.en: in one fell swoop they exceeded the total number of tries scored last year.
sentences.cn: 他们在对方球门线后带球触地的得分一下子超过了去年的得分总数。

sentences.en: More than 100 trees were felled in just over an hour.
sentences.cn: 短短一个多小时100多棵树就被砍倒了。

sentences.en: On either side of the tracks the ground fell away sharply.
sentences.cn: 跑道两侧都是很陡的斜坡。

sentences.en: On the flight from Paris to Toulon, Mechiche fell prey to panic.
sentences.cn: 在从巴黎飞往土伦的航班上，梅希什惊慌失措。

sentences.en: Once the decision was made, things fell into place rapidly.
sentences.cn: 一旦作出决定，事情就立刻顺理成章地发展下去了。

sentences.en: Prices at three-star hotels fell furthest in several northern cities.
sentences.cn: 3星级宾馆的住宿价格在几个北方城市降得最多。

sentences.en: The ball fell straight to the feet of Klinsmann.
sentences.cn: 球直接落到了克林斯曼的脚上。

sentences.en: The dollar fell to within a hair's breadth of its all-time low.
sentences.cn: 美元差一点跌到了最低点。

sentences.en: The earth shook and the walls of neighbouring houses fell around them.
sentences.cn: 地面摇晃，周围房屋的墙体在他们身边倒塌。

sentences.en: Wilde fell and struck his head on the stone floor.
sentences.cn: 怀尔德摔倒了，头撞在石头地上。

sentences.en: Working with Ford closely, I fell in love with the cinema.
sentences.cn: 与福特的密切合作开始令我爱上了电影。

words.tran_cn: 堕落的；落下来的；陷落的
[林]一季所伐的木材；折缝；兽皮
掉下；摔倒；下垂；变坏（fall的过去式）

phrases.phrase: at one fell swoop 或 in one fell swoop

phrases.tran_cn: 卧倒；引不起兴趣；完全失败
爱上…（fall in love with的过去式）

trans.tran_cn: （英格兰北部的）小山，丘陵地区
落下，跌倒（fall的过去式），砍伐，打倒
